page.title: 10The Vicar (continued)
page.content: Pauls. Behind Beresford road stands a Methodist chapel. There is only one resident clergyman of any denomination Mr Fenwick is Seaton Sluice's clergy- man.There is a Roman priest who lives in New Hartley.Mr Fenwick had lived in an old vicarage which was 25O years old until 1983 when a new vicarage was built next door. The reason for this was that the old vicarage was huge and most of it stood empty. Lord Hastings gave the original vicarage to the parish in 1891. In 1984, 21 weddings took place at the church, most of them were held at the parish. It was very rare to get a wedding at St Micheals. 16 baptisms took place and all of them were infant. 34 funerals took place a in the church. In the Middle Ages most churches were dedicated to the{Virgin Mary.
